articles.author: Carissa Wong
articles.title: Where do honey bees come from? New study 'turns the standard picture on its head' - Livescience.com
articles.description: DNA analysis indicates the world's most common bee originated in northern Europe around 780,000 years ago, before spreading into East Africa and Arabia around 120,000 years later.
articles.content:
A new analysis suggests honey bees (Apis mellifera) originated in northern Europe, not Asia as is widely thought.  (Image credit: Claudio Cavalensi/Getty Images)
